ALL_COMP_SALES_CWISE_WB03_B04.description: Comprehensive annual sales matrix for WB03 and B04 business units. This table tracks financial performance across multiple decades (2000-2025), breaking down revenue by Sales Year, Entity (IPL, IVL, IHHL, IHNL), and Channel (Depot, Institution, Export, Service Export, and Toll Manufacturing).

columns.DEPOT_IPL: Depot (Domestic market) sales for Incepta Pharmaceuticals Ltd
columns.DEPOT_IVL: Depot (Domestic market) sales for Incepta Vaccine Ltd
columns.DEPOT_IHHL: Depot (Domestic market) sales for Incepta Hygiene and Hospitacare Ltd
columns.DEPOT_IHNL: Depot (Domestic market) sales for Incepta Herbal and Nutritive Ltd
columns.DEPOT_TOTAL: Sum of all entity sales via the Depot (Domestic) channel
columns.INST_IVL: Institutional sales for Incepta Vaccine Ltd
columns.INST_IHHL: Institutional sales for Incepta Hygiene and Hospitacare Ltd
columns.INST_IHNL: Institutional sales for Incepta Herbal and Nutritive Ltd
columns.INST_TOTAL: Total Institutional sales across all entities
columns.EXPOT_IPL: Export (International) sales for Incepta Pharmaceuticals Ltd
columns.EXPOT_IVL: Export sales for Incepta Vaccine Ltd
columns.EXPOT_IHHL: Export sales for Incepta Hygiene and Hospitacare Ltd
columns.EXPOT_IHNL: Export sales for Incepta Herbal and Nutritive Ltd
columns.EXPOT_TOTAL: Total International/Export revenue excluding service exports
columns.SER_EXPOT_IPL: Service Export revenue for Incepta Pharmaceuticals Ltd
columns.SER_EXPOT_IVL: Service Export revenue for Incepta Vaccine Ltd
columns.SER_EXPOT_TOTAL: Total Service Export revenue (revenue from services rather than goods)
columns.TOLL_MFG_IPL: Toll Manufacturing revenue for IPL (manufacturing for third parties)
columns.ALL_COM_TOTAL: Grand total company sales revenue including all channels (Depot, Inst, Export, Service, Toll) and all entities
columns.CREATE_DATE: Timestamp of when the record was last updated or generated

ALL_COMP_SALES_CWISE_WB03_B04.usage_notes: Use for long-term trend analysis (2000-2025). Note that IVL, IHHL, and IHNL columns may contain null/empty values in earlier years (2000-2010) as those units were likely established later. 'Depot' refers to general trade/pharmacy sales, while 'Inst' refers to bulk hospital/government tenders. All monetary values should be treated as the same currency unit (likely Millions).

ALL_COMPANY_SALES.description: Consolidated annual sales and growth report for all major Incepta business units. This table tracks revenue (Sales) and year-over-year performance (Growth %) for IPL, IVL, IHHL, and IHNL, along with inter-company adjustments and net totals.

columns.SALES_YEAR: The fiscal or calendar year of the record
columns.IPL_SALES: Total sales revenue for Incepta Pharmaceuticals Ltd
columns.IPL_GROWTH: Percentage growth of IPL sales compared to the previous year
columns.IVL_SALES: Total sales revenue for Incepta Vaccine Ltd
columns.IVL_GROWTH: Percentage growth of IVL sales compared to the previous year
columns.IHHL_SALES: Total sales revenue for Incepta Hygiene and Hospitacare Ltd
columns.IHHL_GROWTH: Percentage growth of IHHL sales compared to the previous year
columns.IHNL_SALES: Total sales revenue for Incepta Herbal and Nutritive Ltd
columns.IHNL_GROWTH: Percentage growth of IHNL sales compared to the previous year
columns.TOT_SALES: Gross total sales across all business units before adjustments
columns.TOT_GROWTH: Percentage growth of gross total sales
columns.INTER_COM_SALES: Value of sales made between internal company units (to be deducted for net calculations)
columns.INTER_COM_GROWTH: Percentage change in inter-company sales volume
columns.NET_SALES: Net revenue after deducting inter-company sales (Total Sales - Inter Company Sales)
columns.NET_GROWTH: Percentage growth of net sales revenue
columns.CREATE_DATE: Timestamp of record creation or last update

ALL_COMPANY_SALES.usage_notes: Use this table for high-level executive summaries and growth tracking. 'Growth' columns are percentages (e.g., 7.79 means 7.79% growth). Negative values in 'Growth' indicate a contraction. Inter-company sales are tracked separately to allow for both Gross and Net revenue reporting.

ALL_COMPANY_SALES_CHANNEL_WISE.description: Comprehensive channel-wise sales breakdown for the entire company group. Unlike 'ALL_COMP_SALES_CWISE_WB03_B04' which is a subset (WB03/B04 units), this table aggregates revenue for ALL business units. It aligns with the totals in 'ALL_COMPANY_SALES' but provides the granular split by Channel (Depot, Institution, Export, Service Export, Toll) and Entity.
synonyms: depot vs institution vs export all units

columns.DEPOT_TOTAL: Total Domestic/Depot sales across all entities
columns.ALL_COM_TOTAL: Grand total sales revenue (matches 'NET_SALES' in ALL_COMPANY_SALES table)

ALL_COMPANY_SALES_CHANNEL_WISE.usage_notes: Use this table when the user asks for a channel breakdown (e.g., 'How much did we export?' or 'What are the domestic sales?') for the *entire* company. If the user specifically mentions 'WB03' or 'B04', use the 'ALL_COMP_SALES_CWISE_WB03_B04' table instead.

ALL_COMPANY_SALES_WB03_B04.description: Annual sales and growth report specifically for WB03 and B04 business units. This table tracks revenue (Sales) and year-over-year performance (Growth %) for IPL, IVL, IHHL, and IHNL within these specific units. It allows for comparison between gross totals, inter-company adjustments, and net sales.
synonyms: wb03 b04 net sales vs gross

columns.SALES_YEAR: The fiscal or calendar year of the record
columns.IPL_GROWTH: Percentage growth of IPL sales compared to the previous year
columns.IVL_GROWTH: Percentage growth of IVL sales compared to the previous year
columns.IHHL_GROWTH: Percentage growth of IHHL sales compared to the previous year
columns.IHNL_GROWTH: Percentage growth of IHNL sales compared to the previous year
columns.TOT_SALES: Gross total sales for WB03/B04 units before adjustments
columns.TOT_GROWTH: Percentage growth of gross total sales
columns.INTER_COM_SALES: Value of inter-company sales within these units
columns.INTER_COM_GROWTH: Percentage change in inter-company sales volume
columns.NET_SALES: Net revenue after deducting inter-company sales
columns.NET_GROWTH: Percentage growth of net sales revenue
columns.CREATE_DATE: Timestamp of record creation or last update

ALL_COMPANY_SALES_WB03_B04.usage_notes: Use this table ONLY when the user explicitly queries about 'WB03' or 'B04'. For general company-wide queries, use 'ALL_COMPANY_SALES'. The data structure is identical to the general table, but the values are subsets specific to these units.

BRAND_RANKING_YEARLY.description: Year-over-year brand performance and ranking report. This table compares sales performance between two specific years (designated as YEAR1 and YEAR2) for individual product brands. It tracks Quantity (QTY), Sales Value, Rank Position, Market Contribution, and Growth metrics.

columns.COMPANY_CODE: Internal code for the business unit (e.g., 1000 for IPL, 2000 for IVL)
columns.COMPANY_NAME: Full name of the business unit
columns.COMP_SHORT_NAME: Abbreviated name of the business unit (IPL, IVL, IHHL, IHNL)
columns.BRAND_NAME: Name of the specific product brand (e.g., TWINCARD, PANTOMIX)
columns.YEAR2_NAME: The more recent year being analyzed (e.g., 2024)
columns.YEAR2_QTY: Quantity sold in the recent year
columns.YEAR2_VALUE: Sales revenue in the recent year
columns.YEAR2_RANK_POSITION: Brand's rank based on revenue in the recent year
columns.YEAR2_CONTRIBUTION: Percentage contribution of this brand to total company sales in YEAR2
columns.YEAR1_NAME: The previous year being used for comparison (e.g., 2023)
columns.YEAR1_QTY: Quantity sold in the previous year
columns.YEAR1_VALUE: Sales revenue in the previous year
columns.YEAR1_RANK_POSITION: Brand's rank based on revenue in the previous year
columns.YEAR1_CONTRIBUTION: Percentage contribution of this brand to total company sales in YEAR1
columns.P_GROUP: Product Group classification (often empty in raw data)

BRAND_RANKING_YEARLY.usage_notes: This table is critical for 'Top 10' or 'Best Performing' brand queries. Pay attention to 'YEAR2_RANK_POSITION' for current rankings. 'GROWTH_INDICATE' provides a quick 'UP'/'DOWN' status without calculating numbers.

BRAND_WISE_SALES_DATA.description: Granular monthly sales performance report broken down by Brand, Product, and Territory. Unlike the annual tables, this dataset focuses on specific date ranges (e.g., Month-to-Month comparison) and geographical hierarchy (Region, Area, Territory), tracking both Quantity and Sales Value.

columns.CUR_MONTH_RANGE: The current time period being analyzed (e.g., 'MAR-MAR-24')
columns.PRE_MONTH_RANGE: The previous time period used for comparison (e.g., 'MAR-MAR-23')
columns.COMPANY_CODE: Numeric code for the business unit (e.g., 1000, 3000, 5000)
columns.COMPANY_NAME: Abbreviated name of the business unit (IPL, IHNL, IHHL)
columns.BRAND_NAME: Name of the brand family (e.g., VITAGROW, NEOCARE)
columns.SAP_CODE: Unique SAP system identifier for the product
columns.P_NAME: Full descriptive name of the specific product SKU
columns.RM_TERR_ID: Regional Manager Territory ID (High-level sales region)
columns.AM_TERR_ID: Area Manager Territory ID (Mid-level sales area)
columns.CMR_SOLD_QTY: Quantity sold in the Current Month Range
columns.CMR_SOLD_VALUE: Sales value in the Current Month Range
columns.PMR_SOLD_QTY: Quantity sold in the Previous Month Range
columns.PMR_SOLD_VALUE: Sales value in the Previous Month Range
columns.CREATE_USER: ID of the user who generated the report

BRAND_WISE_SALES_DATA.usage_notes: Use this table for deep-dive queries requiring specific geographical data (e.g., 'How did Sylhet region perform?') or specific time-period comparisons (e.g., 'Compare March 2024 to March 2023'). It is also the only table that provides SKU-level details (P_NAME) distinguishing between different pack sizes or strengths of the same brand.

BRAND_WISE_SALES_REPORT.description: Hierarchical sales performance report focusing on Growth, Ranking, and Contribution. Unlike 'BRAND_WISE_SALES_DATA' which maps sales to territories, this table analyzes performance trends (UP/DOWN) and market position (Rank/Contribution) at three specific levels: Individual Product/SKU (P), Product Strength (PS), and overall Brand Family (PB).

columns.COMPANY_NAME: Name of the business unit (e.g., IPL, IHNL)
columns.BRAND_NAME: Name of the brand family (e.g., REPOSE, SIESTA)
columns.P_NAME: Full descriptive name of the specific product SKU
columns.P_CMR_SOLD_QTY: Product (SKU) Quantity sold in Current Month Range
columns.P_PMR_SOLD_QTY: Product (SKU) Quantity sold in Previous Month Range
columns.P_CMR_SOLD_VALUE: Product (SKU) Sales Value in Current Month Range
columns.P_PMR_SOLD_VALUE: Product (SKU) Sales Value in Previous Month Range
columns.P_GROWTH_INDICATE: Growth direction for the specific SKU ('UP' or 'DOWN')
columns.PS_GROWTH_INDICATE: Growth direction for the Product Strength ('UP' or 'DOWN')
columns.PB_GROWTH_INDICATE: Growth direction for the overall Brand Family ('UP' or 'DOWN')
columns.P_CODE_CMR_SL: Rank/Serial position of the SKU in Current Month
columns.P_CODE_PMR_SL: Rank/Serial position of the SKU in Previous Month
columns.PS_CMR_SL: Rank/Serial position of the Strength in Current Month
columns.PS_PMR_SL: Rank/Serial position of the Strength in Previous Month
columns.PB_CMR_SL: Rank/Serial position of the Brand in Current Month
columns.PB_PMR_SL: Rank/Serial position of the Brand in Previous Month
columns.P_CMR_CONTRIBUTION: Percentage contribution of this SKU to total sales in Current Month
columns.P_PMR_CONTRIBUTION: Percentage contribution of this SKU to total sales in Previous Month
columns.PS_CMR_CONTRIBUTION: Percentage contribution of this Strength to total sales in Current Month
columns.PS_PMR_CONTRIBUTION: Percentage contribution of this Strength to total sales in Previous Month
columns.PB_CMR_CONTRIBUTION: Percentage contribution of this Brand to total sales in Current Month
columns.PB_PMR_CONTRIBUTION: Percentage contribution of this Brand to total sales in Previous Month
columns.CUR_MONTH_RANGE: The current date range being analyzed (e.g., 'NOV-DEC-22')
columns.PRE_MONTH_RANGE: The previous date range used for comparison (e.g., 'NOV-NOV-21')
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who generated the report

BRAND_WISE_SALES_REPORT.usage_notes: Use this table when the user asks about 'Growth Trends' (e.g., 'Which brands are going UP?'), 'Rankings' (e.g., 'What is the rank of Repose?'), or 'Contribution' (e.g., 'How much does this SKU contribute to total sales?'). It allows for nuanced analysis because a single SKU might be 'DOWN' while the overall Brand is 'UP'.

COMPANY_WISE_SALES_SUMMARY.description: Monthly sales summary broken down by specific business sectors and divisions within each company. Unlike other tables that split by 'Channel' (Depot/Inst), this table splits by 'Product Category' (e.g., Animal Health, Human Health, Diaper, Infusion). It provides a high-level monthly performance view of these specific operational divisions.

columns.SALES_MONTH: Month and Year of the record (e.g., 'SEP-19', 'FEB-20')
columns.IPL_GENERAL: Sales revenue from IPL General Pharma products (Human Health)
columns.IPL_INSTITUTE: Sales revenue from IPL Institutional/Hospital business
columns.IPL_ANIMAL_HEALTH: Sales revenue from IPL Animal Health division
columns.IPL_TOTAL: Total monthly sales for Incepta Pharmaceuticals Ltd
columns.IVL_HUMAN: Sales revenue from IVL Human Vaccines
columns.IVL_ANIMAL: Sales revenue from IVL Animal Vaccines
columns.IVL_INSTITUTE: Sales revenue from IVL Institutional business
columns.IVL_TOTAL: Total monthly sales for Incepta Vaccine Ltd
columns.IHHL_TOTAL: Total monthly sales for Incepta Hygiene and Hospitacare Ltd
columns.IHNL_TOTAL: Total monthly sales for Incepta Herbal and Nutritive Ltd
columns.TOTAL: Grand total monthly sales across all companies and divisions

COMPANY_WISE_SALES_SUMMARY.usage_notes: Use this table specifically when the user asks about 'Animal Health', 'Diaper', or 'Infusion' sales, or wants to compare 'Human vs Animal' performance. The 'IPL_GENERAL' column typically represents the core human pharmaceutical business.

DASH_NATIONAL_REPORT.description: Daily national sales dashboard report tracking targets vs. achievement at the Depot and SKU level. This table provides a snapshot of daily operations, showing how specific Sales Areas (e.g., Kushtia, Comilla) are performing against their targets for individual products. It includes metrics for Quantity, Value, Discounts, and Stock levels.

entities.Sales Areas: Regional depots or territories (e.g., Kushtia, Comilla, Feni)
entities.Product Groups: Operational divisions (e.g., KINETIX, ZYMOS, ANIMAL HEALTH)

columns.SALES_AREA_CODE: Numeric identifier for the sales area
columns.NAME: Name of the Sales Area or Depot (e.g., 'Kushtia', 'Dhaka')
columns.DEP_T_TGT: Depot Trade Target Quantity (Used for Achievement calculation)
columns.QTY_EXP_SALE: Total Quantity Sold (Sum of Sold + Int)
columns.VAL_EXP_SALE: Total Sales Value (Sum of Val Sold + Val Int)
columns.QTY_STOCK: Current quantity in stock at the depot
columns.ACH: Achievement Percentage (Total Qty Sold / Depot Trade Target * 100)
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who generated the record

DASH_NATIONAL_REPORT.usage_notes: Use this table for tactical, daily queries like 'Which depots missed their target yesterday?' or 'What is the stock level of Omidon in Kushtia?'. The 'ACH' column gives a direct percentage performance metric. 'QTY_EXP_SALE' represents the total effective sales volume.

DASHBOARD_USERS_INFO.description: User management and authentication registry for the sales dashboard. This table stores employee credentials, role assignments, and specific access rights (which Territories or Product Groups they can view). It is used for login verification and permission handling.

columns.ID: Unique system identifier for the user record
columns.NAME: Full name of the user/employee
columns.USER_ID: Unique login ID or Employee ID (e.g., 1015975)
columns.P_GROUP: Product Group access scope (e.g., 'GENERAL', 'ALL' - defines which products the user can see)
columns.TERR_ID: Territory ID access scope (e.g., 'NSM0', 'HO', 'All' - defines which regions the user can see)
columns.UPASSWORD: Bcrypt hashed password string for secure authentication
columns.UROLE: Numeric User Role ID defining permission level (e.g., 1, 3, 4)
columns.RAW_PASSWORD: Unmasked/Plaintext password (Sensitive column, likely for recovery or initial setup)
columns.SALES_REPORT: Flags or codes indicating specific report access permissions (e.g., 'ALL')
columns.REMARK1: General remarks or notes about the user account
columns.EMP_PLANT: Plant or Manufacturing Unit code associated with the employee
columns.CREATE_DATE: Timestamp when the user account was created
columns.CREATE_USER: ID of the admin who created this user account

DASHBOARD_USERS_INFO.usage_notes: Use this table to look up who has access to specific data (via P_GROUP or TERR_ID) or to map 'CREATE_USER' IDs from other tables to actual names. WARNING: This table contains 'RAW_PASSWORD' and 'UPASSWORD'; treat this data as highly sensitive credential information.

DEPOT_GROUP_WISE_SALES.description: Daily sales performance report broken down by Depot and Product Group. This table tracks Target vs. Actual Sales values for specific operational divisions (e.g., Hygiene, Human Vaccine) within each depot. It also includes working day metrics (Total Working Days vs. Worked Days) for run-rate analysis.

entities.P_GROUP: Major Product Groups/Divisions (e.g., HYGIENE (DIAPER), HUMAN VACCINE, HERBAL & NUTRICARE, HOSPICARE, KINETIX)

columns.REPORT_UPTO: The data cut-off date for the report
columns.REPORT_DATE: The date the report was generated or presented
columns.TWD: Total Working Days in the month (e.g., 27)
columns.D_ID: Numeric ID of the Depot/Sales Center
columns.P_GROUP: Name of the Product Group or Division
columns.TARGET_VALUE: Monetary sales target for this group at this depot

DEPOT_GROUP_WISE_SALES.usage_notes: Use this table to analyze divisional performance at a depot level. The 'TWD' (Total Working Days) and 'WD' (Worked Days) columns are essential for calculating 'Required Run Rate' or 'Pro-rated Target' (e.g., is the depot ahead or behind schedule given the number of days passed?).

DEPOT_SALE.description: Daily operational sales ledger for depots. This table records the most granular daily transaction details, distinguishing between 'Sold' (Regular Trade) and 'Int' (Internal/Institutional) transactions. It tracks Quantities, Values, and specific Discount amounts (Volume Discount, Trade Discount) for each Product (P_CODE) within each Territory (TERR_ID).

columns.WDATE: Actual Date of the sales transaction (Working Date)
columns.WDAY: Working Day number of the month (e.g., 17)
columns.TERR_ID: Territory ID associated with the sale
columns.TODAY_CMIC: Today's Contribution Margin (Current Month)? / Cost Metric?
columns.TODAY_PMIC: Today's Contribution Margin (Previous Month)? / Cost Metric?
columns.CMONTH_SOLD_QTY: Cumulative Sold Quantity for the Current Month
columns.CMONTH_SOLD_VALUE: Cumulative Sold Value for the Current Month
columns.CMONTH_SOLD_VOLUME_DIS: Cumulative Volume Discount given this month
columns.INT_VOLUME_DIS: Volume Discount on Internal sales today
columns.INT_TRADE_DIS: Trade Discount on Internal sales today
columns.SOLD_VOLUME_DIS: Volume Discount on General sales today
columns.SOLD_TRADE_DIS: Trade Discount on General sales today

DEPOT_SALE.usage_notes: Use this table for auditing daily operations. It answers questions like 'How much discount was given on Zymos products in Kushtia yesterday?' or 'What is the daily split between Trade Sales and Internal Sales for this territory?'. It contains the rawest form of daily transactional data.

DHK_GRP_MKT_WISE_SALES.description: Daily sales breakdown specifically for the Dhaka region, segmented by Market Type. This table analyzes Product Group performance across three distinct channels: Dhaka Retail (City Pharmacies), Mitford (Wholesale Market), and Outstation (Peripheral areas).

entities.Mitford: The largest wholesale medicine market in Bangladesh (located in Old Dhaka)
entities.Dhaka Retail: Direct sales to pharmacies within Dhaka city
entities.Outstation: Sales to areas outside the main Dhaka metro area but managed by this unit

columns.TWD: Total Working Days in the month
columns.P_GROUP: Product Group or Division name (e.g., CELLBIOTIC, ZYMOS)
columns.DHAKA_RETAIL: Sales revenue from retail pharmacies in Dhaka
columns.MITFORD: Sales revenue from the Mitford wholesale market
columns.GRAND_TOTAL: Total sales sum of Retail + Mitford + Outstation

DHK_GRP_MKT_WISE_SALES.usage_notes: Use this table specifically to analyze the 'Mitford' effect (wholesale contribution) or to compare city-center retail vs. peripheral sales for specific product groups in Dhaka.

EXPO_ABC.description: Registry of international export partners and product registrations. This table maps specific products to their destination countries and provides details on the local 'Agent' (distributor/partner) and the primary contact person. It also includes product-specific details like Generic Name and Pack Size.

entities.Agent Company: The local distributor or partner company in the destination country
entities.Agent Person: The specific point of contact at the distributor's office

columns.EXPORT_COUNTRY: Name of the destination country (e.g., Armenia, Sri Lanka, Togo)
columns.PRODUCT_NAME: Brand name of the product being exported (e.g., Levoxin, Trego)
columns.GENERIC_NAME: The generic or chemical name of the active ingredient (e.g., Levofloxacin, Mupirocin)
columns.FINISH_PRODUCT_CODE: Code for the specific finished good/SKU
columns.AGENT_COMPANY: Name of the local agent or distributor company
columns.AGENT_PERSON: Name of the key contact person at the agent company

EXPO_ABC.usage_notes: Use this table to answer questions about international operations, such as 'Who is our agent in Sri Lanka?', 'What products are registered in Togo?', or 'Who is the contact person for APES Pharma?'. It bridges the gap between products and foreign markets.

EXPO_AGENT_LIST.description: Master directory of international export customers and agents. This table contains the core contact and address information for all foreign entities Incepta does business with. It includes unique Customer IDs, full addresses (Street, City, Country), and communication details (Phone, Fax).

entities.Search Term: Short code or alias used to quickly find the customer

columns.CUSTOMER: Unique numeric identifier for the international customer/agent
columns.COUNTRY: Name of the country where the customer is located
columns.NAME_1: Primary legal name of the customer company
columns.NAME_2: Secondary name or continuation of the company name
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID of the admin who created the record

EXPO_AGENT_LIST.usage_notes: Use this table when you need the physical address or phone number of an international partner. It is often cross-referenced with 'EXPO_ABC' using the Agent Name to get full contact details.

EXPO_COUNTRY_LIST.description: Master reference table for country codes and names. This table lists standardized two-letter codes (e.g., 'AD', 'AE') mapped to their full country names. It acts as a lookup source for validating country entries in other export-related tables.

entities.Country Name: Full official English name of the country

columns.COUNTRY_NAME: Full English name of the country (e.g., 'United States', 'Bangladesh')
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID of the admin who added the country to the list
columns.CREATE_DATE: Timestamp when the record was created

EXPO_COUNTRY_LIST.usage_notes: Use this table to standardize country names or resolve codes found in other tables. For example, if another table uses 'AE', this table confirms it stands for 'United Arab Emirates'. It is essential for generating dropdown lists or validating user input for geography.

EXPO_COUNTRY_WISE_PRODUCTS.description: Detailed registry mapping specific finished export products (SKUs) to their destination countries and designated local agents. Unlike the simpler 'EXPO_ABC' view, this table includes the specific physical address of the agent for each product registration, along with system audit trails (creation and update logs).

columns.ID: Unique system identifier for the registration record
columns.FINISH_PRODUCT_CODE: Unique code for the specific finished good/SKU
columns.PRODUCT_NAME: Brand name of the export product
columns.PRODUCT_GENERIC: Generic name of the active ingredient
columns.COMPANY_AGENT_NAME: Name of the local agent company
columns.CONTACT_NAME: Name of the contact person at the agency
columns.ADDRESS: Full physical address of the agent for this specific product context
columns.CREATE_USER: ID of the user who created this record
columns.CREATE_DATE: Timestamp when the record was created
columns.UPDATED_AT: Timestamp when the record was last modified
columns.UPDATE_USER: ID of the user who last modified the record

EXPO_COUNTRY_WISE_PRODUCTS.usage_notes: Use this table when the query requires the specific *address* of an agent for a particular product, or for auditing purposes (e.g., 'Who updated the record for Myanmar?'). It provides the most complete contact details linked to a specific SKU.

EXPO_INFO.description: Comprehensive regulatory affairs tracking table for international product registrations. This table monitors the entire lifecycle of an export product's registration process in a specific country. It tracks detailed milestones including Dossier preparation (CTD/Non-CTD), API sourcing, submission to local agents and regulatory bodies, approval status, registration certificates, renewals, and variations.

columns.LINE_ID: Unique system identifier for the tracking record
columns.STATUS: Current status of the registration (e.g., 'REG' for Registered, 'NEW', 'Process')
columns.RENEW_STATUS: Status of the renewal process if applicable
columns.FINISH_PRODUCT_CODE: Code for the finished export product
columns.EXPO_PRODUCT_NAME: Brand name used in the export market
columns.COMPANY_AGENT_NAME: Name of the local agent company
columns.IM_TEAM: Name/ID of the International Marketing team member responsible
columns.SUBMITTED_TO_IM: Date dossier was submitted to IM team
columns.SUB_BY_IRA: Name of the IRA team member responsible
columns.CTD_API_SOURCE: Source of API for CTD dossiers
columns.NONCTD_API_SOURCE: Source of API for Non-CTD dossiers
columns.SUBMITTED_TO_AGENT: Date dossier was sent to the local agent
columns.SUBMITTED_TO_REGULARITY: Date dossier was submitted to the local regulatory authority
columns.UPDATE_USER_IM_STAGE1: User who updated the IM Stage 1 status
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who created the record
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record
columns.DROPPED_BY_AGENT_MAH: Flag if dropped by Agent or Marketing Authorization Holder
columns.WITHDRAWAL_FORM_RA_DATE: Date of withdrawal from Regulatory Authority
columns.EXPIRY_RENEWAL_DATE: Date when the registration expires or needs renewal
columns.REG_CERT_PATH: File path/URL to the scanned registration certificate
columns.REG_SHELF_LIFE_PRODUCT: Approved shelf life of the product
columns.LAUNCHED_DATE: Date the product was commercially launched

EXPO_INFO.usage_notes: Use this table for deep-dive questions about the *status* of a registration (e.g., 'Is Cefamax registered in Sri Lanka?', 'When does the license for Pantonix expire in Kenya?'). It is the definitive source for regulatory compliance data.

EXPO_INFO_ABC.description: Workflow-focused export registration tracker containing a subset of regulatory data. This table is likely optimized for the International Marketing (IM) and Agent coordination teams, focusing heavily on submission dates (Submitted to IM, Agent, Regulatory), approval milestones, and status updates. It acts as a timeline monitor for the registration process.

columns.COMPANY_AGENT_NAME: Name of the local agent company
columns.CONTACT_NAME: Contact person at the agent company
columns.SUBMITTED_TO_IM: Date the dossier was submitted to the International Marketing team
columns.SUB_BY_IRA: Name of the IRA member handling the submission
columns.SUBMITTED_TO_AGENT: Date the dossier was sent to the Agent
columns.SUBMITTED_TO_REGULARITY: Date the dossier was submitted to the Regulatory Authority
columns.UPDATE_USER: User who last modified the record
columns.DROPPED_BY_AGENT_MAH: Flag if dropped by Agent/Marketing Authorization Holder
columns.WITHDRAWAL_FORM_RA_DATE: Date of withdrawal from Regulatory Authority

EXPO_INFO_ABC.usage_notes: Use this table when queries focus on the *timeline* of submissions (e.g., 'When was the dossier sent to the agent?') or for tracking the specific workflow steps between IM and IRA teams. For full technical dossier details (API source, Stability data), use 'EXPO_INFO' instead.

EXPO_PERMISSION_GROUP.description: Access control definition table for the export module. This reference table defines the specific permission levels (e.g., Read Only, Read and Extract, Read/Write) that can be assigned to user groups. It acts as a security classification system for data access.

entities.Extract: The ability to export data to Excel/CSV
entities.Write: The ability to create or modify records
entities.Read: The ability to view data only

columns.PERMISSION_ID: Unique numeric identifier for the permission level
columns.PERMISSION_TYPE: Description of the access rights (e.g., 'Read, Write and Extract', 'Read only')
columns.REMARKS: Additional notes regarding the permission scope
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID of the admin who defined this permission type
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID of the admin who last updated the record

EXPO_PERMISSION_GROUP.usage_notes: Use this table to interpret the 'Permission ID' found in user assignment tables. It explains what a specific ID (e.g., 1, 2, 3) actually allows the user to do.

EXPO_PLANT.description: Master reference table for manufacturing plants and operational units. This table maps numeric Plant IDs (used in export and sales tables) to their specific facility names (e.g., Savar Factory, Animal Health Unit, Vaccine Unit). It is essential for decoding the 'PLANT_ID' column found throughout the database.

columns.PLANT_ID: Unique numeric identifier for the manufacturing plant (e.g., 1100, 2100)
columns.PLANT_NAME: Official name of the manufacturing facility or unit (e.g., 'FACTORY(SAVAR)', 'IPL-ANNIMAL HEALTH')
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID of the admin who created the record

EXPO_PLANT.usage_notes: Use this table to resolve 'PLANT_ID' references found in other tables like 'EXPO_INFO', 'EXPO_ABC', or 'DASHBOARD_USERS_INFO'. For example, if a user asks 'Which products are made in the Vaccine Unit?', you first look up the ID for 'Vaccine' here (2100) and then filter the product tables by that ID.

EXPO_PLANT_WISE_PRODUCTS.description: Registry mapping base products to their specific manufacturing plant or unit. Unlike the export country maps, this table focuses on the production source, linking a 'Product Code' to a 'Plant ID' (e.g., showing which products are made in the Vaccine Unit vs. the Savar Factory).

columns.PLANT_ID: Numeric identifier for the manufacturing plant (e.g., 1100, 2100)
columns.PRODUCT_CODE: Unique code for the base product
columns.PRODUCT_NAME: Brand name of the product (e.g., 'Tetrafast 250 Capsule')
columns.PRODUCT_GENERIC: Generic name of the active ingredient (e.g., 'Sucralfate', 'Semaglutide')
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID of the admin who created the record
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID of the admin who last updated the record

EXPO_PLANT_WISE_PRODUCTS.usage_notes: Use this table to answer questions about manufacturing origins, such as 'Which products are manufactured in the Vaccine Unit?' or 'Where is Fitaro produced?'. It links directly to 'EXPO_PLANT' via 'PLANT_ID'.

EXPO_REPORT_GROUP.description: Configuration table for grouping multiple reports together. This table defines 'Report Groups' where the 'RPT_TYPE' column typically contains a pipe-separated list of specific Report IDs (e.g., '3|4|9|10') or keywords like 'All'. This allows for managing access or display of reports in bundles rather than individually.

entities.Report IDs: Numbers found within the pipe-separated lists (e.g., 3, 4, 9, 10)

columns.RPT_ID: Unique numeric identifier for the report group
columns.RPT_TYPE: Definition of the group content. Usually a string of pipe-delimited Report IDs (e.g., '3|4|9|10') or special keywords (e.g., 'All')
columns.REMARKS: Description or name of the report group (e.g., 'All Report')
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID of the admin who created the group
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID of the admin who last updated the record

EXPO_REPORT_GROUP.usage_notes: Use this table to understand which specific reports (by ID) are included in a group. You will often need to split the 'RPT_TYPE' string by the '|' character to get the individual Report IDs.

EXPO_REPORT_GROUP_DETAILS.description: User access assignment table for the export module. This table links specific employees (EMP_ID) to defined Report Groups and Permission types. It controls 'who sees what' by assigning a specific scope of access (e.g., 'All reports') and a permission level (e.g., 'Read and Extract') to individual users.

columns.EMP_ID: Employee ID of the user being assigned access (e.g., 1000001)
columns.NAME: Full name of the employee
columns.TEAM: Internal team or department code (e.g., 'IM-1', 'Quality Control')
columns.SCOPE_OF_ACCESS: Text description of the data scope assigned (e.g., 'All reports', 'Report no. 3 & 4')
columns.REPORT_GROUP: Numeric ID linking to the 'EXPO_REPORT_GROUP' table (defines which bundle of reports they see)
columns.PERMISSION_TYPE: Text description of the permission level (e.g., 'Read and Extract')
columns.PERMISSION_GROUP: Numeric ID linking to the 'EXPO_PERMISSION_GROUP' table (defines the technical access level)
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID of the admin who assigned the access
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID of the admin who last updated the assignment

EXPO_REPORT_GROUP_DETAILS.usage_notes: Use this table to check an individual user's access rights. For example, 'Does Ehsan Aziz have write access?' or 'Who are the members of IM-1 with access to the system?'. It bridges the gap between the abstract 'Groups' and actual 'People'.

EXPORT_INSTITUTE_SAL_DET_TEMP.description: Detailed monthly sales ledger for institutional and export channels. Unlike the summary tables, this table records specific product sales (SKU level) to foreign countries or domestic institutions by month. It tracks Quantity, Value, and the specific destination Country for each transaction block.

entities.INSTITUTION: Domestic bulk sales (e.g., Government tenders, Hospitals)

columns.SALES_MONTH: The month and year of the transaction (e.g., 'APR-2023', 'SEP-2023')
columns.COMPANY_CODE: Numeric code for the business unit (e.g., 1000)
columns.COMPANY_NAME: Name of the business unit (e.g., IPL)
columns.SAP_CODE: Unique SAP system identifier for the product
columns.P_NAME: Full descriptive name of the product (often includes strength, pack size, and destination market tag like 'CHILE' or 'ZAMBIA')
columns.COUNTRY: Destination country for export sales or territory for institutional sales
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who created the record
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

EXPORT_INSTITUTE_SAL_DET_TEMP.usage_notes: Use this table for granular queries about specific export shipments or institutional deals, such as 'How much Amidol was sold to institutions in April 2023?' or 'List all export sales to Chile'. Note that the 'P_NAME' often contains specific market identifiers.

EXPORT_INSTITUTE_SALES_DETAILS.description: Master historical sales ledger for specialized channels: Export, Institution, and Deemed Export. This table records granular transaction details (SKU level) for every month. Unlike the '_TEMP' table which might hold current/processing data, this table serves as the permanent history of non-retail revenue, tracking specific products sold to foreign countries, domestic institutions, or special economic zones (Deemed Export).

entities.INSTITUTION: Domestic bulk sales (e.g., Govt tenders, Army, Hospitals)
entities.DEEMED EXPORT: Sales to domestic Special Economic Zones (EPZ) or projects treated as exports

columns.SALES_MONTH: The month and year of the transaction (e.g., 'JAN-21')
columns.COMPANY_CODE: Numeric code for the business unit (e.g., 1000)
columns.COMPANY_NAME: Name of the business unit (e.g., IPL)
columns.SAP_CODE: Unique SAP system identifier for the product
columns.P_NAME: Full descriptive name of the product (often includes pack size)
columns.COUNTRY: Destination country (for Export) or Territory/Institution name
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who created the record
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

EXPORT_INSTITUTE_SALES_DETAILS.usage_notes: Use this table for long-term historical analysis (e.g., 'Show me Deemed Export sales for 2021'). If the user specifically asks about 'Deemed Export', this is the primary table to check, as other tables may group it under generic 'Export' or 'Institution' headers.

EXPORT_SALES_GROWTH.description: Year-over-year export sales performance report tracking revenue in both US Dollars (USD) and Bangladeshi Taka (BDT). This table is essential for analyzing international revenue trends and currency conversion impacts over time. It calculates percentage growth based on the sales volume.

columns.SALES_YEAR: Calendar year of the sales report (e.g., 2011, 2012)
columns.SALES_USD: Total Export Sales Revenue in Million USD
columns.SALES_BDT: Total Export Sales Revenue in Million BDT
columns.GROWTH: Year-over-year percentage growth (calculated on BDT value)

EXPORT_SALES_GROWTH.usage_notes: Use this table for high-level financial trend analysis. It is the only table that explicitly provides the USD equivalent of sales, which is useful for forex analysis. Note that the 'GROWTH' column is typically calculated based on the BDT figures.

GM_SM_SALES_ANALYSIS_ACH.description: Sales performance and achievement analysis for high-level management roles. This table tracks the annual targets, actual sales, and percentage achievement for General Managers (GM), Sales Managers (SM), and Deputy Sales Managers (DSM). It allows for performance evaluation of the sales leadership team.

columns.SALES_YEAR: The fiscal or calendar year of the performance review (e.g., 2020, 2025)
columns.NAME: Full name of the sales executive
columns.TARGET_VALUE: Total sales target assigned to this manager (in Millions)
columns.SALES_VALUE: Total actual sales achieved by this manager (in Millions)
columns.CREATE_DATE: Date the record was created or updated

GM_SM_SALES_ANALYSIS_ACH.usage_notes: Use this table when the user asks about specific people in leadership (e.g., 'How did Ashraf Uddin Ahmed perform in 2025?') or wants to compare management tiers (e.g., 'List all SMs who achieved 100% target').

GROUP_WISE_SALES_RM_TO_GM.description: Hierarchical sales performance report mapping the entire chain of command from Regional Manager (RM) to General Manager (GM). Unlike other tables that focus on Depots or Products, this table focuses on People and Leadership. It shows who reports to whom and tracks Target vs. Achievement at every level of the sales organization (RM -> ASM -> DSM -> SM -> NSM -> GM).

columns.TWD: Total Working Days in the month
columns.P_GROUP: Product Group or Division (e.g., ZYMOS, CELLBIOTIC)
columns.RM_TERR_ID: Territory ID of the Regional Manager
columns.ASM_ID: Employee ID of the Area Sales Manager
columns.ASM_NAME: Name of the Area Sales Manager
columns.DSM_ID: Employee ID of the Deputy Sales Manager
columns.DSM_NAME: Name of the Deputy Sales Manager
columns.SM_ID: Employee ID of the Sales Manager
columns.NSM_ID: Employee ID of the National Sales Manager
columns.NSM_NAME: Name of the National Sales Manager
columns.GM_ID: Employee ID of the General Manager
columns.TGT_VALUE: Sales Target assigned to this hierarchy line
columns.TODAY_PRODUCT_OUT: Value of product that left the depot/warehouse today
columns.TOTAL_IN_TRANSIT: Value of product currently in transit to customers/depots

GROUP_WISE_SALES_RM_TO_GM.usage_notes: Use this table for organizational structure queries (e.g., 'Who is the ASM for Kushtia?', 'Who does Alamgir Hossain report to?') or for evaluating leadership performance (e.g., 'Which SM has the highest achievement in the Zymos group?').

LONG_LIST_INFORMATION.description: Comprehensive cross-functional tracker for the international product registration pipeline ('Long List'). This table monitors the end-to-end readiness of export products, tracking status across multiple departments: Supply Chain (SCM) for API sourcing, R&D Analytical (RDA) for method validation, R&D Formulation (RDF) for stability and bioequivalence, Quality Control (QC) for specifications, and International Regulatory Affairs (IRA) for dossier compilation.

entities.IRA: International Regulatory Affairs (Oversees the registration process)
entities.DDS: Dossier Development Services (or similar internal documentation team)
entities.IVA / IVB: Climatic Zones for Stability Studies (Zone 4A / Zone 4B)

columns.SERIAL_NO: Serial number for the list entry
columns.IRA_TEAM: International Regulatory Affairs team responsible (e.g., IM-1, IM-2)
columns.IRA_COUNTRY: Target export country code (e.g., GH, KE, MY)
columns.IRA_GENERIC_NAME: Generic name of the active ingredient
columns.IRA_DOSS_TYPE: Type of dossier (e.g., CTD, ACTD, Non-CTD)
columns.RDA_REL_SUBST_MV_START: Start date: Related Substances Method Validation
columns.RDA_REL_SUBST_MV_COMP: Completion date: Related Substances Method Validation
columns.RDA_OTHERS_MV_TEST: Other tests required for Method Validation
columns.RDA_RELATED_SUBST_MT_START: Start date: Related Substances Method Transfer
columns.RDA_RELATED_SUBST_MT_COMP: Completion date: Related Substances Method Transfer
columns.RDA_OTHERS_MT_TEST: Other tests required for Method Transfer
columns.QC_FP_REMARKS: Remarks regarding Finished Product QC docs
columns.QC_RM_REMARKS: Remarks regarding Raw Material QC docs
columns.QC_PM_REMARKS: Remarks regarding Packaging Material QC docs
columns.RDF_LAB_STAB_KEPT_ON_DATE: Date lab batch kept on stability
columns.UPDATED_BY: User who last updated the record
columns.LONG_LIST_STATUS: Overall status on the Long List

LONG_LIST_INFORMATION.usage_notes: Use this table for complex status queries like 'Is the method validation complete for Emixef?' or 'What is the stability status of Timozin in Zone 4B?'. It provides a granular view of every stage of product development for export markets. The prefixes (IRA, SCM, RDA, QC, RDF) indicate which department owns the data.

LONG_LIST_REQ_PROD_LIST.description: Reference list of products requested for the export pipeline ('Long List'). This table acts as a simplified directory, mapping specific Product Names (including strength and form) to the responsible International Marketing (IM) team. It likely serves as a source or validation list for the more detailed tracking tables.

entities.IM-1: International Marketing Team 1 (Responsible for a specific set of export markets/products)

columns.ID: Unique numeric identifier for the request record
columns.PRODUCT_NAME: Full name of the requested product, often including strength and dosage form (e.g., 'LINATAB E 5/10 TABLET', 'MICAGIN IV INFUSION')
columns.TEAM: ID of the internal team responsible for this product (e.g., 'IM-1')

LONG_LIST_REQ_PROD_LIST.usage_notes: Use this table as a simple lookup to find which IM Team is responsible for a specific product, or to get a clean list of all products currently under consideration for the Long List without the complexity of the full tracking table.

LONG_LIST_ROLES.description: Role definition table for the Long List application. This table defines the various user roles (e.g., Admin, SCM User, IRA User) and maps them to specific permission sets. It acts as the central authority for what each type of user is allowed to do within the export pipeline tracker.

entities.IRA User: International Regulatory Affairs user (likely focused on dossier tasks)
entities.SCM User: Supply Chain Management user (focused on material sourcing)

columns.ID: Unique numeric identifier for the role
columns.ROLE_NAME: Display name of the user role (e.g., 'Super Admin', 'SCM User')
columns.ROLE_SLUG: Unique technical string used in code to identify the role (e.g., 'super-admin', 'scm-user')
columns.PERMISSIONS: JSON-formatted string or list defining the specific actions this role can perform (e.g., creating records, editing specific fields, viewing reports)

LONG_LIST_ROLES.usage_notes: Use this table to interpret user capabilities. For instance, if you need to know who can edit SCM data, you would look for the 'SCM User' role here and then find users assigned that role in the user table.

MONTH_WISE_SALES_REPORT.description: Monthly sales performance report summarizing Target vs. Actual Achievement and Year-over-Year (YoY) growth. This table provides the 'big picture' financial trend, comparing specific months (e.g., Jan 2024) against their targets and the same month in the previous year to calculate growth percentages.

entities.Target: The sales goal set for the month
entities.Growth: Percentage increase/decrease compared to the same month last year

columns.TARGET_VALUE: Total sales target for the month
columns.SALES_VALUE: Total actual sales achieved in the month
columns.ACHIEVEMENT: Percentage of the target achieved (Sales / Target * 100)
columns.LAST_YEAR_SALES: Total sales value from the same month in the previous year
columns.GROWTH: Percentage growth compared to last year ((Current - Last) / Last * 100)
columns.CREATE_DATE: Timestamp when the record was created or updated

MONTH_WISE_SALES_REPORT.usage_notes: Use this table for high-level trend analysis, such as 'How much did sales grow in January compared to last year?' or 'Did we hit the target in December?'. It does not provide breakdowns by product or depot.

MONTH_WISE_SALES_RP_WB03_B04.description: Yearly sales summary matrix organized by calendar year. This table provides a wide-format view of sales performance, listing monthly revenue figures (Jan-Dec) for each year. It also breaks down total revenue by channel (Depot, Special, Institution, Export, Toll Mfg) and calculates the Grand Total and Year-over-Year Growth percentage.

entities.SPECIAL_SALES: Sales from special campaigns or non-standard channels
entities.TOLL_MFG: Revenue from Toll Manufacturing (contract manufacturing for others)

columns.SALES_YEAR: The calendar year of the record (e.g., 2020, 2024)
columns.DEPO_TOTAL: Sum of all monthly depot sales
columns.GRAND_TOTAL: Sum of all sales channels for the year
columns.GRAND_GROWTH: Year-over-Year percentage growth of the Grand Total

MONTH_WISE_SALES_RP_WB03_B04.usage_notes: Use this table for long-term historical analysis (e.g., 'How has export revenue changed from 2010 to 2024?', 'What was the sales growth in 2020?'). It is the best source for seeing the composition of total revenue (Depot vs Export vs Inst) over time.

NATIONAL_TARGET_SALES_ACHVM.description: Daily national sales performance report tracking Target vs. Actual Sales for individual products. This table provides a granular view of achievement at the SKU level, listing the National Target Quantity ('N_TGT_QTY') and Actual Sales Quantity ('N_SALES_QTY') for the current month. It is used to monitor daily progress against sales goals.

entities.P_GROUP: Product Group or Division (e.g., KINETIX, CELLBIOTIC, GYRUS)

columns.REPORT_DATE: Date and time the report was generated
columns.TWD: Total Working Days in the month
columns.P_CODE: Unique short code for the product
columns.N_TGT_QTY: National Target Quantity assigned for the month
columns.N_SALES_QTY: National Actual Sales Quantity achieved so far

NATIONAL_TARGET_SALES_ACHVM.usage_notes: Use this table to check the specific performance of a product, such as 'What is the achievement for Timopress Eye Drops?'. It provides the most direct comparison of 'Plan vs. Actual' for the sales team.

PRODUCT_GROUP_WISE_SALES.description: Comparative sales report aggregated by Product Group (Division). This table analyzes performance trends by comparing the current month's sales ('CURRENT_MONTH_SALES') against the previous month ('LAST_MONTH_SALES'). It includes daily sales figures and specific working day counts for both periods (Current: TWD/WD, Previous: PTWD/PWD) to allow for accurate run-rate comparisons.

entities.P_GROUP: Major Product Groups/Divisions (e.g., KINETIX, ANIMAL VACCINE, OPERON-XENOVISION)

columns.TWD: Total Working Days in the current month
columns.WD: Working Days elapsed in the current month
columns.PTWD: Total Working Days in the previous month
columns.PWD: Working Days elapsed in the previous month (for comparison)
columns.P_GROUP: Name of the Product Group or Division
columns.TODAY_SALES: Sales revenue generated on the reporting date
columns.LAST_MONTH_SALES: Total sales revenue for the previous month
columns.CURRENT_MONTH_SALES: Cumulative sales revenue for the current month
columns.GROWTH: Percentage growth in sales (Current vs. Last Month)

PRODUCT_GROUP_WISE_SALES.usage_notes: Use this table to identify which business divisions are growing or shrinking compared to the previous month. The inclusion of 'TODAY_SALES' also allows for immediate daily performance checks.

PRODUCT_RANKING_DEPOT_SALES.description: Comparative product ranking report analyzing sales performance between two specific months (Month 1 vs. Month 2). This table tracks shifts in market position (Rank), sales value, and contribution to total sales, explicitly highlighting whether a product's performance is trending 'UP' or 'DOWN'. It allows for month-over-month winner and loser analysis.

entities.Month 1: The previous or baseline month for comparison (e.g., OCT-25)
entities.Month 2: The current or focal month for comparison (e.g., NOV-25)

columns.COMPANY_NAME: Full name of the company (e.g., IPL)
columns.BRAND_NAME: Name of the product brand (e.g., RIFAMAX, BONE-GUARD)
columns.MONTH2_CONTRIBUTION: Percentage contribution to total sales in Month 2
columns.MONTH1_CONTRIBUTION: Percentage contribution to total sales in Month 1
columns.GROWTH: Numeric growth value/percentage between Month 1 and Month 2
columns.GROWTH_INDICATE: Text indicator of the trend ('UP' or 'DOWN')
columns.P_GROUP: Product Group associated with the brand

PRODUCT_RANKING_DEPOT_SALES.usage_notes: Use this table to find the top performing products for a specific month or to see which products are losing market share. Queries like 'What were the top 10 products in November?' or 'Which products sales went down compared to last month?' should use this table.

RM_SALES_ANALYSIS_ACH.description: Sales performance analysis for Regional Managers (RM). This table tracks the annual targets, actual sales, and percentage achievement for individual Regional Managers. It maps each RM to a specific Territory ID and Product Group (Division), serving as a key performance indicator (KPI) report for mid-level sales leadership.

entities.RM: Regional Manager (Sales leader for a region)

columns.SALES_YEAR: The fiscal or calendar year of the performance review (e.g., 2019, 2025)
columns.RM_TERR_ID: Unique identifier for the Regional Manager's territory (e.g., 'SO-00', 'CTG1-00')
columns.P_GROUP: Product Group or Division the RM is responsible for (e.g., 'OPERON-XENOVISION', 'GENERAL')
columns.NAME: Full name of the Regional Manager
columns.TARGET_VALUE: Total annual sales target assigned to the RM (in Millions)
columns.SALES_VALUE: Total actual annual sales achieved by the RM (in Millions)

RM_SALES_ANALYSIS_ACH.usage_notes: Use this table to evaluate the performance of specific Regional Managers or to compare achievement across different territories. For example, 'Who was the RM for Comilla in 2019?' or 'Which RM achieved the highest percentage in the General division?'.

SCM_APP_BLOCKLIST.description: Supply Chain Management (SCM) Block List Application table. This table tracks the application and approval details for importing raw materials (API) and lab items. In the pharmaceutical context (specifically in Bangladesh), a 'Block List' is a regulatory permission list for importing specific quantities of raw materials for a given year. It records details like the Blocklist Number, Year, Material Name, Manufacturer, Supplier, Quantity, and Prices (Air/Sea/Road).

columns.LINE_ID: Unique identifier for the line item
columns.APP_ID: Application ID linked to the block list request
columns.BL_TYPE: Type of Block List entry (e.g., 'API', 'Lab Item')
columns.BLOCKLIST_YEAR: Fiscal or Calendar year for the Block List (e.g., '2021-2022')
columns.BLOCKLIST_DATE: Date of the Block List issuance
columns.PLANT: Plant or LC (Letter of Credit) Reference Code (e.g., 'I003', 'I009')
columns.BLOCKLIST_NO: Official Block List Number assigned by the regulatory authority
columns.MATERIAL_NAME: Name of the material being imported
columns.MANUFACTURER_NAME: Name and country of the manufacturer
columns.SUPPLIER_NAME: Name and country of the supplier
columns.AIR_PRICE: Approved unit price if shipped by Air
columns.ROAD_PRICE: Approved unit price if shipped by Road
columns.SEA_PRICE: Approved unit price if shipped by Sea
columns.CFP: Corresponding Finished Product (e.g., 'Revert Tablet') linked to this raw material
columns.QTY_FINISH_PRODUCT: Projected quantity of finished product to be produced with this material
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who created the record
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

SCM_APP_BLOCKLIST.usage_notes: Use this table to find details about approved import permissions. For example, 'Who is the approved manufacturer for Cinnarizine BP?' or 'What is the approved quantity for Mefenamic Acid in the 2021-2022 block list?'. It links raw materials to their specific approved sources.

MANUFACTURER_NAME: Shaanxi Baoxin Pharmaceutical Co. Ltd., China

SCM_APPLY_REJECTED_DATA.description: Archive table for rejected Supply Chain Management (SCM) block list applications. This table stores the details of import requests (raw materials, lab items) that were denied approval. It mirrors the structure of the approved block list table, recording the material, supplier, price, and quantity requested but ultimately rejected. This data is critical for audit trails and analyzing rejection reasons.

entities.Rejected Item: A specific line item (Material + Supplier) that was denied import permission
entities.CFP: Corresponding Finished Product (The drug intended to be made with the rejected material)

columns.LINE_ID: Unique identifier for the line item
columns.APP_ID: Application ID linked to the rejected request
columns.BL_TYPE: Type of Block List entry (e.g., 'API', 'Lab Item')
columns.BLOCKLIST_YEAR: Fiscal or Calendar year for the requested Block List
columns.BLOCKLIST_DATE: Date associated with the block list request
columns.BLOCKLIST_NO: Block List Number (if assigned before rejection, often null or preliminary)
columns.MANUFACTURER_NAME: Name and country of the proposed manufacturer
columns.SUPPLIER_NAME: Name and country of the proposed supplier
columns.AIR_PRICE: Proposed unit price if shipped by Air
columns.ROAD_PRICE: Proposed unit price if shipped by Road
columns.SEA_PRICE: Proposed unit price if shipped by Sea
columns.CFP: Corresponding Finished Product linked to this material request
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who created the request
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

SCM_APPLY_REJECTED_DATA.usage_notes: Use this table to audit failed import attempts. For example, 'Which suppliers had the most rejected applications in 2021?' or 'Was the request for Danazol USP rejected?'. It helps identify problematic suppliers or pricing issues.

SCM_AVAILABLE_QTY_CLEAR.description: Table tracking the specific cleared or available quantities of raw materials against assigned Block List numbers. This table likely functions as a ledger for import permissions, recording how much of a specific material (identified by 'MATERIAL_NAME') from a specific block list ('BLOCKLIST_NO') has been cleared for use or remains available.

entities.Clear Qty: Quantity processed/cleared for import or use

columns.BLOCKLIST_NO: The unique identifier for the Block List permission (e.g., 'I003-2018-00068')
columns.MATERIAL_NAME: Name of the raw material or item (e.g., 'GLYCOCHOLIC ACID INN')
columns.CLEAR_QTY: The quantity of the material that has been cleared or is available
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID of the person who created the record

SCM_AVAILABLE_QTY_CLEAR.usage_notes: Use this table to check the status of specific import permissions. For example, 'How much Glycocholic Acid has been cleared from blocklist I003-2018-00068?' or 'Check available quantities for Amikacin Sulphate'.

SCM_AVAILABLE_QTY_CLEAR_T.description: Temporary or staging table for tracking cleared material quantities. This table allows for intermediate processing or validation of clearance data before it is finalized in the main 'SCM_AVAILABLE_QTY_CLEAR' table. It shares the exact same schema, linking specific cleared quantities to their Block List numbers.

entities.Clear Qty: Quantity processed/cleared for import or use

columns.BLOCKLIST_NO: The unique identifier for the Block List permission (e.g., 'I003-2018-00068')
columns.MATERIAL_NAME: Name of the raw material or item (e.g., 'GLYCOCHOLIC ACID INN')
columns.CLEAR_QTY: The quantity of the material that has been cleared or is available
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID of the person who created the record

SCM_AVAILABLE_QTY_CLEAR_T.usage_notes: Use this table primarily for debugging or checking data that might be in-transit or processing. For definitive historical records, prefer the main 'SCM_AVAILABLE_QTY_CLEAR' table.

SCM_BL_AMENDMENT_INFORMATION.description: Table tracking official amendments to approved Supply Chain Block Lists. This table records changes made to existing permissions, such as modifying the approved quantity, price, or supplier information. It serves as an audit trail for regulatory modifications ('Correction' or 'Amendment') after the initial approval.

entities.Amendment: A formal change to the approved block list details
entities.Correction: A minor fix or adjustment to the record

columns.ID: Unique identifier for the amendment record
columns.BLOCKLIST_NO: The unique identifier of the Block List being amended (e.g., 'I003-2018-00003')
columns.AMENDMENT_NO: Sequential number of the amendment (e.g., '1st Amendment')
columns.AMENDMENT_REASON: Description or reason for the change (e.g., 'Price Correction', 'Quantity Increase')
columns.PREVIOUS_VALUE: Original value before the change (if applicable)
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who recorded the amendment
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

SCM_BL_AMENDMENT_INFORMATION.usage_notes: Use this table to trace the history of a block list. If a user asks 'Why did the price change for Blocklist I003?' or 'Show me all amendments for 2018', this is the source.

SCM_BLK_MAT_BK_2017_2019.description: Historical archive table for Supply Chain Management (SCM) Block List materials, covering the specific period of 2017-2019. This table serves as a backup registry for import permissions, recording details of raw materials, lab items, and equipment approved for import during those fiscal years. It mirrors the structure of the main block list table but is static and used for retrospective analysis.

entities.Material: Raw material or lab item approved for import

columns.BLOCKLIST_YEAR: Fiscal or Calendar year for the Block List (e.g., '2018-2019')
columns.BLOCKLIST_DATE: Date of the Block List issuance
columns.BLOCKLIST_NO: Official Block List Number assigned by the regulatory authority
columns.MATERIAL_NAME: Name of the material imported (e.g., 'KROMASIL 100-10-C4 Ph. Gr.')
columns.MANUFACTURER_NAME: Name and country of the manufacturer
columns.SUPPLIER_NAME: Name and country of the supplier
columns.AIR_PRICE: Approved unit price if shipped by Air
columns.ROAD_PRICE: Approved unit price if shipped by Road
columns.SEA_PRICE: Approved unit price if shipped by Sea
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who created the record
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

SCM_BLK_MAT_BK_2017_2019.usage_notes: Use this table for historical queries specifically targeting the 2017-2019 period. For example, 'What was the price of Valsartan in 2018?' or 'Who supplied Goat anti Mouse IgG in 2019?'. Do not use this for current operational data.

SCM_BLOCKLIST_FILES_TABLE.description: Document management index for Supply Chain Block Lists. This table stores metadata and file paths for digital documents (PDFs) associated with specific block lists. It acts as a bridge between the database records and the actual scanned files stored on the server (e.g., 'public\SCM\BlockListFiles\...'), allowing users to retrieve and view the original approved documents.

entities.Filename: Name of the physical file (often matching the Block List No, e.g., I003-2021-00001.pdf)

columns.ID: Unique numeric identifier for the file record
columns.PLANT: Plant code associated with the file (e.g., 'I003')
columns.COMPANY_FULL_NAME: Full name of the company entity (e.g., 'Incepta Pharmaceuticals Ltd.')
columns.FILELOCATION: Relative path to the file storage location on the server
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID of the person who uploaded the file
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

SCM_BLOCKLIST_FILES_TABLE.usage_notes: Use this table to find the actual PDF document associated with a block list. For example, 'Where is the scanned copy of Blocklist I003-2021-00001 stored?'. Note that the 'FILENAME' usually corresponds directly to the 'BLOCKLIST_NO' found in other tables.

SCM_BLOCKLIST_MATERIAL.description: Detailed material list for Supply Chain Block Lists. This table records the specific raw materials, chemicals, or items included in a block list permission. It includes precise chemical names (often with CAS numbers), the approved manufacturer and supplier, quantity, unit of measure (UOM), and the approved unit prices for different shipping modes (Air, Road, Sea).

entities.Material: Specific chemical or raw material (e.g., 'Sodium metabisulfite', 'Tert-Butyl Methyl Ether')

columns.BLOCKLIST_YEAR: Fiscal or Calendar year for the Block List (e.g., '2025-2026')
columns.BLOCKLIST_DATE: Date of the Block List issuance
columns.BLOCKLIST_NO: Unique identifier for the Block List (e.g., 'I017-2025-R25063233')
columns.MATERIAL_NAME: Full descriptive name of the material, often including CAS number
columns.MANUFACTURER_NAME: Name and country of the manufacturer
columns.SUPPLIER_NAME: Name and country of the supplier
columns.AIR_PRICE: Approved unit price for Air shipment
columns.ROAD_PRICE: Approved unit price for Road shipment
columns.SEA_PRICE: Approved unit price for Sea shipment
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who created the record
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

SCM_BLOCKLIST_MATERIAL.usage_notes: Use this table to find the approved price or supplier for a specific material. For example, 'What is the air price for Sodium metabisulfite?' or 'Who supplies Tert-Butyl Methyl Ether for blocklist I017-2025-R25063232?'. Note the inclusion of CAS numbers in the material name field.

MANUFACTURER_NAME: SHANDONG WONFULL PETROCHEMICAL GROUP CO., LTD. CHINA
SUPPLIER_NAME: United Pharma Industries Co., Ltd. China
HANGZHOU CHERRY PHARMACEUTICAL TECHNOLOGY CO., LTD. China

SCM_BLOCKLIST_MATERIAL_24_25.description: Partitioned material details table for Supply Chain Block Lists covering the fiscal years 2024-2025. This table is a specific subset of the main material list, recording the raw materials, manufacturers, suppliers, and approved prices for import permissions issued during this period. It allows for focused analysis of the 2024-25 procurement cycle.

entities.Material: Specific chemical or raw material (e.g., 'Sitagliptin Phosphate Monohydrate INN')

columns.BLOCKLIST_YEAR: Fiscal or Calendar year for the Block List (e.g., '2024-2025')
columns.BLOCKLIST_DATE: Date of the Block List issuance
columns.BLOCKLIST_NO: Unique identifier for the Block List (e.g., 'I003-2024-00001')
columns.MATERIAL_NAME: Full descriptive name of the material
columns.MANUFACTURER_NAME: Name and country of the manufacturer
columns.SUPPLIER_NAME: Name and country of the supplier
columns.AIR_PRICE: Approved unit price for Air shipment
columns.ROAD_PRICE: Approved unit price for Road shipment
columns.SEA_PRICE: Approved unit price for Sea shipment
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who created the record
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

SCM_BLOCKLIST_MATERIAL_24_25.usage_notes: Use this table for queries specifically targeting the 2024-2025 fiscal year. For example, 'What was the approved price for Sitagliptin in 2024?' or 'List all materials imported from China in the 24-25 block list'.

MANUFACTURER_NAME: Hubei Biocause Heilen Pharmaceutical Co. Ltd.

SCM_BLOCKLIST_MATERIAL_BKUP.description: Backup archive for deleted Block List material records. This table stores line items that have been removed from the active 'SCM_BLOCKLIST_MATERIAL' table. It serves as a 'Recycle Bin' or audit log for deletions, preserving the original data along with a 'DELETE_DATE' timestamp to track when the removal occurred.

entities.Deleted Item: A material record that was removed from the active block list
entities.Block List: The original permission the item belonged to

columns.BLOCKLIST_YEAR: Fiscal or Calendar year for the Block List
columns.BLOCKLIST_DATE: Date of the Block List issuance
columns.BLOCKLIST_NO: Unique identifier for the Block List (e.g., 'I003-2018-10930')
columns.MATERIAL_NAME: Name of the material that was deleted
columns.MANUFACTURER_NAME: Name and country of the manufacturer
columns.SUPPLIER_NAME: Name and country of the supplier
columns.QTY: Quantity that was approved before deletion
columns.AIR_PRICE: Approved unit price for Air shipment
columns.ROAD_PRICE: Approved unit price for Road shipment
columns.SEA_PRICE: Approved unit price for Sea shipment
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who created the record
columns.DELETE_DATE: Timestamp when the record was deleted
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

SCM_BLOCKLIST_MATERIAL_BKUP.usage_notes: Use this table to recover lost data or investigate accidental deletions. For example, 'When was the entry for Spirulina Powder deleted?' or 'Show me all materials deleted in 2019'.

SCM_CLEARANCE.description: Customs clearance tracking table for imported materials. This table records the actual execution of the import permission, linking the 'Block List No' to commercial documents like the Letter of Credit (LC) and Commercial Invoice. It tracks the specific quantity cleared, the invoice date, and the manufacturer/supplier for each shipment.

entities.LC: Letter of Credit (Banking document for payment)
entities.CRTF: Clearance Certificate or Release Order date

columns.ID: Unique identifier for the clearance record
columns.LC_NO: Letter of Credit Number used for the shipment
columns.INV_NO: Commercial Invoice Number from the supplier
columns.CRTF_DATE: Certificate or Clearance Date (when goods were released)
columns.SL: Serial number of the item in the invoice/clearance
columns.BLOCKLIST_NO: The Block List Number authorizing this import
columns.QTY: Quantity cleared in this specific shipment
columns.RATE: Unit price charged in this invoice
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who entered the clearance data
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

SCM_CLEARANCE.usage_notes: Use this table to track actual shipments. If a user asks 'When did the Cefuroxime arrive?' or 'Which invoice covers the shipment of Racecadotril?', this is the table to query.

SCM_COMPANY_INFO.description: Registry of company entities and manufacturing plants. This table acts as the central reference for the organizational structure, linking Plant Codes (e.g., 'I003', 'I010') to full Company Names, Head Office and Factory Addresses, Import License numbers, and other regulatory registration details.

entities.Plant Code: Short code identifying a specific manufacturing site (e.g., I003, I010)
entities.Import License: Legal permit number for importing goods (e.g., BA-111064)

columns.PLANT: Unique short code for the plant/entity (e.g., 'I003')
columns.COMPANY_FULL_NAME: Full legal name of the company (e.g., 'Incepta Pharmaceuticals Ltd.')
columns.FIRM_WITH_ADDRESS: Combined firm name and address string
columns.IMPORT_IN_TAKA: Import limit or value in local currency (Taka)
columns.ARRIVAL: Approved ports of entry (e.g., 'DHAKA AIRPORT/CHITTAGONG SEA PORT')
columns.BL_NUMBER: Block List reference number pattern or base
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who created the record
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

SCM_COMPANY_INFO.usage_notes: Use this table to look up address or license details for a plant. For example, 'What is the factory address for plant I010?' or 'Which company does the code I020 represent?'.

SCM_COMPARATIVE_FINAL_DATA.description: Comparative procurement analysis table. This table aggregates purchase requests ('PURCH_REQ'), requested delivery dates, and actual approved quantities to facilitate decision-making. It includes fields for management comments ('COMMENT_GM_SCM', 'COMMENT_VICE_CHAIRMAN') and tracks key metrics like 'LAST_UNIT_PRICE_KG' and 'NEW_UNIT_PER_KG' to monitor price variance.

entities.PR: Purchase Request (Internal request to buy material)
entities.Material: Raw material or item being purchased

columns.USER_CREATED_AT: Timestamp when the user created the comparison entry
columns.COMMENT_GM_SCM: Remarks from the General Manager of SCM
columns.CREATE_USER: User ID who created the record
columns.UPDATE_USER: User ID who last updated the record

SCM_COMPARATIVE_FINAL_DATA.usage_notes: Use this table to analyze procurement decisions. For example, 'What was the last purchase price for Fentanyl Citrate?' or 'Show me all purchase requests approved by the Vice Chairman'.
